text:
Whoever pursues justice and kindness will find life and honor.

Proverbs 21:21

And by the way, the fact that ppl are scrambling to repackage this whole conversation to make it palatable for largely affluent, white suburban “swing” voters again points to how much more electoral & structural power these communities have relative to others

Just for awareness!

Our job as policymakers is to take the public’s mandate and find + create pockets to advance as much progress as possible.

Progress takes a team of different roles. You don’t criticize a pitcher for not being a catcher.

We can respond in ways that don’t undercut impt work

Lots of DC insiders are criticizing frontline activists over political feasibility and saying they need a new slogan.

But poll-tested slogans and electoral feasibility is not the activists’ job. Their job is to organize support and transform public opinion, which they are doing.

“Defund” means that Black & Brown communities are asking for the same budget priorities that White communities have already created for themselves: schooling > police,etc.

People asked in other ways, but were always told “No, how do you pay for it?”

So they found the line item.

RT @heatherscope “It is not crazy for black and brown communities to want what white people have already given themselves and that is funding your schools more than you fund criminalizing your own kids,” @AOC told her colleagues yesterday. 

From last night: https://www.politico.com/news/2020/06/08/defund-police-democrats-307766

Not long ago, “Black Lives Matter” was *also* a rallying cry for justice that politicians worried polled too poorly, was too “divisive” & required “too much explanation.”

Now Mitt Romney is saying it.

Progress is a process. It’s normal to work through discomfort along the way.

We need true criminal justice reform, something I’ve been saying and leading on for many years. We have taken the First Step. It’s time to take more. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaEyyeUXgAU7nFu.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1270352240461611009/vid/480x270/En2hnGj_twiF27kJ.mp4?tag=13

This past weekend “was the most violent weekend in Chicago’s history stretching police resources that were already thin because of protests & looting.”
 
It is beyond comprehension that Democrats’ response to this trend would be to reduce police protection.https://chicago.suntimes.com/crime/2020/6/8/21281998/chicago-violence-murder-history-homicide-police-crime
The hymn exhorts:  "then sings my soul."  When our troubled nation joins hands and sings together "then sings my soul"  then and only then will our nation begin to heal.

If you want your neighborhood to rise up out of the ashes, if you want your kids to rise up and see a better day, if you want the violence to end, everyone must rise up, hand in hand, and seek an inner grace that will still a troubled nation.
Pastor Brooks can't save you. He might be able to guide you to the light but only you can save yourself.

I'm part of your government but I'm here today to say that government can't save you. Sure government plays a vital role in public safety.

But government can't mend a broken soul.

Government can't provide salvation.
There is a sickness among us that crosses racial boundaries and threatens to consume us.

Before you say whose this white guy coming to my neighborhood talking about crime let me say it happens in my neighborhood too.

A while back a white woman in my town stole a woman's baby by cutting the baby out of her mother and leaving the mother to bleed to death.
But when I hear people say black lives matter, I also think of Jacele Johnson who is four years old who was shot in the head on the south side of Chicago.
When I hear people say black lives matter, I think of Freddie Gray whose neck was broken and died in government custody.
When I hear people say black lives matter, I think of Eric Garner who was choked to death for selling untaxed cigarettes.

These are some of the words I used in my speech to his church. We have been reminded of the issues we still have to conquer by multiple recent tragedies. Black lives matter. We must do better and we must heal.  

We must rise up together and join hands.

Read his account of what’s happening now to understand the full problem and possible solutions. https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/chicago-pastor-this-weeks-violence-has-set-our-black-community-back-decades/

I visited Pastor Brooks' school and church in 2015.  Even then he was worried that violence was chasing businesses, restaurants sway from South Chicago. I tried to convince a major restaurant chain to re-open in the neighborhood but my request fell on deaf ears.

RT @Eugene_Scott Martin Gugino, the 75-year-old Buffalo man shoved by two 30-something police officers, is a member of PUSH Buffalo, which focuses on affordable housing, and Western New York Peace Center, a human rights org. He is also part of the Catholic Worker Movement. https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2020/06/06/buffalo-officers-charged/ http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaEj6u5WsAAil72.jpg
@JamaalBowmanNY Wouldn’t have it any other way 💪🏽💜
@SenBobCasey @SenKamalaHarris @TheBlackCaucus Thank you @SenBobCasey for your work advancing this critical legislation.
@MartinHeinrich @SenKamalaHarris Grateful for your leadership and work on this important legislation @MartinHeinrich
@SenatorBaldwin @SenKamalaHarris @TheBlackCaucus Thank you @SenatorBaldwin for your leadership and helping us move this critical legislation forward.

Charles Booker (@Booker4KY) is running for Senate & building the kind of principled, inclusive, and winning coalition in Kentucky that can inspire positive change.

The US Senate will be a better place with him in it. I’m proud to endorse him.

Let’s go:
https://secure.actblue.com/donate/aoc-social-booker?refcode=tw2020610

RT @MondaireJones .@BernieSanders built a movement that brought #MedicareForAll into the political mainstream. I’m running for Congress to help achieve his vision of guaranteeing health care for every single American. This is an issue of racial & economic justice. Join us: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/mondairebernie?refcode=twitter https://twitter.com/berniesanders/status/1270377246574993408 QT @BernieSanders .@MondaireJones is a progressive community leader who, as an attorney, has led efforts to win justice for vulnerable communities through litigation and public policy. If elected to Congress, he'll fight for bold, progressive policies that help working people. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaFJTjFWAAYWRAl.jpg

In his final act at @USOCC, Comptroller Otting rammed through a plan to gut banks’ anti-discrimination rules. I’m urging acting Comptroller Brian Brooks to undo this damage, withdraw this hastily-finalized rule, & protect our nation's anti-redlining law. https://thehill.com/policy/finance/501781-warren-urges-bank-regulator-to-scrap-anti-redlining-effort

RT @JamaalBowmanNY I’m honored to have the endorsement of @BernieSanders, someone who has been fighting for civil rights, racial and economic justice, and on behalf of working people for his entire life. 

He led the way for the kind of campaign we’re running: grassroots and no corporate donations. https://twitter.com/berniesanders/status/1270376973995565062 QT @BernieSanders .@JamaalBowmanNY is a public school teacher and principal who understands that low-income families are locked out of opportunity and a decent life due to a rigged system. In Congress he'll fight to invest in public schools, end mass incarceration, and address the housing crisis. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaFJEtjXsAA5aBn.jpg

RT @SamelysLopez I am so proud to have earned the endorsement of @BernieSanders!

It’s time to bring Bernie’s working class revolution to the South Bronx.

We are in the last push of our primary so please donate through the link below!

https://secure.actblue.com/donate/bernie-congressional

RT @SiegelForTexas Bernie has inspired this campaign in so many ways. 

We are fighting for #MedicareForAll & a #GreenNewDeal. To challenge the foundations of a corrupt political system.

Most of all, his commitment to "fight for someone you don't know." That's why we do this.

Thank you, Senator. https://twitter.com/BernieSanders/status/1270377676105289728 QT @BernieSanders .@SiegelForTexas is a civil rights attorney and former public school teacher running a people-powered campaign that doesn't rely on support from corporate PACs. After spending his career fighting to give everyone a fair shot at success, he is ready to take that fight to Congress. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaFJqQgXQAMsHMV.jpg

RT @CoriBush I chose to be a surrogate for Senator Sanders’ campaign because I recognized the power he would bring as Organizer-in-Chief. He supported me & my voice back before it was “popular” to listen to Ferguson activists. I’ve never been more ready to fight alongside him in Congress! ✊🏾 https://twitter.com/berniesanders/status/1270377088118411266 QT @BernieSanders .@CoriBush is a nurse and community activist who emerged as a leader while working on the front lines of the Ferguson movement as a protestor, clergy member, medic, and victim of police assault. Now she is continuing the bold fight for justice and running for U.S. House in MO-1. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaFJMIHWsAA5xLd.jpg

Democrats’ calls to defund or disband the police are asinine and would end up killing many Americans if enacted.
https://www.wsj.com/articles/defund-police-watch-crime-return-11591658454

.@SiegelForTexas is a civil rights attorney and former public school teacher running a people-powered campaign that doesn't rely on support from corporate PACs. After spending his career fighting to give everyone a fair shot at success, he is ready to take that fight to Congress. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaFJqQgXQAMsHMV.jpg

.@SamelysLopez is a community organizer running for U.S. House in NY-15. Her leadership has been instrumental in building a community-led grassroots political movement in the Bronx, and now she is ready to fight for our progressive values in Congress. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaFJfe1WkAAI1GY.jpg

In Congress he'll fight to invest in public schools, end mass incarceration, and address the housing crisis. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaFJEtjXsAA5aBn.jpg

He was an endorser of our campaign for president and supports progressive policies such as criminal justice reform, Medicare for All, and getting big money out of politics. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaFI_ioXYAEnDql.jpg

One of the ways we must continue building our movement is by electing progressives at all levels of government. Today I am proud to endorse six candidates for Congress. If you can afford to right now, I hope you will consider making a contribution: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/bernie-congressional/?refcode=tw200609

Why is it, that in the wealthiest country in modern history, high school students who live four miles apart have radically different access to education?

This pandemic has laid bare the deep injustices that existed long before the crisis. https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/tale-two-zip-codes-covid-19-exposes-deep-disparities-u-n1227646
I am proud to offer my endorsement and support to @adkins_2020 for Congress in #KS03, and I am asking you to join me in supporting her: https://amandaadkins2020.com/ #BuilderBeliever
We must rethink how we keep our communities safe. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaFALnPWsAIvBXY.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1270366462172110849/vid/480x270/wYe46gAxAgBZlc3a.mp4?tag=13

RT @JulianCastro District attorneys are on notice: if you don’t have the courage to support change and to hold police officers accountable for misconduct, voters will find someone who will. https://twitter.com/abc/status/1270375548099977216 QT @ABC NEW: District attorneys for Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn and the Bronx issue joint statement "in support of proposed city and state legislation that would criminalize the use of chokeholds and similar restraints by law enforcement officers." https://trib.al/u4R7Z6e

Heaven forbid liberal newsrooms publish alternative points of view.
 
Apparently the marketplace of ideas is out, and being #woke is in. https://nypost.com/2020/06/08/the-thought-police-are-seizing-control-of-americas-liberal-newsrooms/?utm_source=twitter_sitebuttons&utm_medium=site%20buttons&utm_campaign=site%20buttons

As George Floyd is laid to rest next to his mother today, I’m holding his family and friends in my heart. His murder sparked a powerful movement and we won’t stop fighting for justice for him and his loved ones.

Voting machines down.
Limited provisional ballots. 
Hours-long lines. 

#VoterSuppression is happening right now across Georgia, particularly in Black communities. We can't let this happen in November. Congress must immediately pass my VoteSafe Act.
It’s past time for all three police officers who murdered Breonna Taylor to be arrested. It’s been almost three months. There’s no reason for them to still be roaming free.

As key competitors like China advance their capabilities in space, now more than ever it is crucial we continue developing partnerships w the commercial space sector & supporting @NASA’s crucial work, not only to protect but enhance US leadership in space. https://ir.shareaholic.com/e?a=1&u=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2020/jun/8/time-to-get-american-astronauts-back-to-the-moon-a/%3Futm_campaign%3Dshareaholic%26utm_medium%3Dtwitter%26utm_source%3Dsocialnetwork&r=1

@KimFoxxforSA Thank you, Kim, for your kind words. Your leadership has brought about bold and historic change to the Cook County criminal justice system and I know you will continue to pave the way for generations to come.

RT @AyannaPressley Yes, it’s possible to legislate justice & accountability and write budgets that actually value Black lives. If it feels unfamiliar, that’s because we’re trying to do something that’s never been done in America.

Leftist Democrats’ radical idea to abolish police departments is dangerous, and the people who will pay the price are not Hollywood celebrities and East Coast elites; they are the families who live in low-income communities. https://nypost.com/2020/06/08/defunding-the-nypd-is-madness-after-the-thousands-of-black-lives-they-have-saved/?utm_source=twitter_sitebuttons&utm_medium=site%20buttons&utm_campaign=site%20buttons

Congratulations to Fabiana Pierre-Louis on her historic nomination to the NJ Supreme Court. If confirmed, she’ll be the first Black woman to ever serve on the highest court in our state. https://www.essence.com/feature/nj-supreme-court-nominee-fabiana-pierre-louis/

Today, Americans in Houston and across the country join the Floyd family in grieving the loss of a nephew, a father, a brother, and a friend. We pray for swift justice for #GeorgeFloyd and his family.

1.7 million students have police in their school but no counselor.
3 million have police but no nurse.
6 million have police but no psychologist.
10 million have police but no social worker.

We need systemic change—now.

RT @civilrightsorg TONIGHT: Along with the @DFADCoalition, we’re holding a #VoteForOurLives virtual rally at 7pm ET. Tune in to hear from @SpeakerPelosi, @RevDrBarber, @DoloresHuerta, @vanitaguptaCR, and more.

RSVP and learn more here: https://www.facebook.com/events/600744160850537/ http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaF0zBkWoAwCmeo.jpg

Trump and too many Republicans and Democrats in Congress want to approve a defense budget increasing military spending to $740 billion a year. Wrong! We should cut military spending and invest in jobs, education, housing and health care. I will introduce legislation to do that.

Our bill: 
✅Creates the first-ever National Police Misconduct Registry
✅Changes the Section 242 standard to enable more prosecutions of law enforcement misconduct
✅Mandates data collection of use of force data for states to better diagnose the problem of excessive use of force https://twitter.com/voxdotcom/status/1270093277358886919 QT @voxdotcom Democrats’ new bill shows where the party wants to go on police reform https://www.vox.com/2020/6/8/21283841/democrats-police-reform-bill-explained-george-floyd?utm_campaign=vox&utm_content=chorus&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter

Welcome news that human rights defender #NabeelRajab was released
after years in prison in #Bahrain over social media posts critical of the govt. We must continue to press for the release of political prisoners and prisoners of conscience worldwide. #ExpressionNOTOppression https://twitter.com/afp/status/1270381388622180352 QT @AFP #UPDATE Bahraini rights activist #NabeelRajab, who played a key role in 2011 anti-government protests, was freed from jail Tuesday after serving time over tweets critical of the Saudi-led military campaign in Yemen https://news.yahoo.com/bahrain-activist-nabeel-rajab-freed-jail-time-over-141905607.html http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaFJNk5WsAE_bJE.jpg

We need voters to stay safe, not be silenced—and one simple way to do that is to allow all Americans to vote by mail, while also enhancing the safety of in-person voting. You can take action right now to ensure leaders protect the right to vote safely. https://elizabethwarren.com/Democracy?source=soc-WB-ew-tw-democracry-rollout

Congress needs to pass vote-by-mail, online registration, and in-person voting protections. But this fight also comes down to the states—and whether elected officials step up to protect our democracy during this crisis. We can't let up.
https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2020/06/coronavirus-voting-rights/

RT @DanRather So much news today, but don't overlook the voting debacle happening right now in Georgia. This is a dire wakeup call for November - long lines, broken machines. It is a national outrage that undermines the legitimacy of our democracy.

🚨 #HappeningNow 🚨

Senator Rubio delivers speech on the shocking & unjust death of Mr. Floyd, and how the American family can begin addressing systemic and unaddressed racial disparities.

Watch LIVE ⬇️
https://www.c-span.org/congress/?chamber=senate

African Americans are more than 2X likely to be killed by police. Yesterday @CoryBooker, the Congressional Black Caucus, and I released the first-ever comprehensive police accountability and reform legislation on the federal level to address police misconduct.

RT @lbarronlopez Took @MsLaToshaBrown 3hrs to vote today in GA. Then Brown drove over to predominantly white polling site in Atl suburbs

“I come over to this side of town, and white folks are strolling in. On my side of town, we brought stadium chairs.”

https://www.politico.com/news/2020/06/09/georgia-primary-election-voting-309066
W/@ZachMontellaro

RT @IlhanMN In 2016 when I ran against a 44yr incumbent, people told me saying #BlackLivesMattters was wrong messaging and I would lose.

Today, not only did I win that race but everyone is falling over themselves to say #BlackLivesMattters. 

We speak to our values, not their messaging.
RT @jbouie an election where people are waiting for 7 or 8 hours to cast a ballot is not a free and fair election

RT @NYWFP This moment was made possible by the Black organizers and allies who spent decades organizing to end police secrecy and violence, and pushed our elected officials to enact this long-overdue change. https://twitter.com/ZachReports/status/1270424453193895937 QT @ZachReports BREAKING: The NYS Senate has just PASSED a repeal of 50a 

This allows for the public disclosure of NYPD disciplinary records after recent protests created an opportunity to pass the bill after years of effort. 

Gov. Cuomo has said he will sign the bill.

Any New Yorker can tell you that this group does not look representative of the NYPD at all.

Most NYPD patrol officers are Black, Latino, or Asian American - and the overall force is about 1/5 women.

So what’s going on here? 👀⬇️ https://twitter.com/augusttakala/status/1270399690912272384 QT @AugustTakala WATCH 🚨 New York police boss Mike O'Meara went off on the media today:

"Stop treating us like animals and thugs and start treating us with some respect ... Our legislators abandoned us. The press is vilifying us. It's disgusting." http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1270398221156847618/pu/img/zC_I5R3bw7iVe6MS.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1270398221156847618/pu/vid/478x270/N3oIuHREFUpayEY-.mp4?tag=10

As a member of the Senate Armed Services Committee, I filed an amendment to the annual defense bill last week to rename all bases named for Confederate generals. It's long past time to end the tribute to white supremacy on our military installations. https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2020/06/take-confederate-names-off-our-army-bases/612832/

Republicans don’t want vote by mail bc it chips away at their ability to do exactly this: target and disenfranchise Black voters and people of color.

These scenes are specifically happening in Black communities, not white ones.

This is BY DESIGN,& it’s their test run for Nov ⬇️ https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1270433009033007106 QT @nytimes This drone footage shows a long line of voters waiting to cast ballots in Atlanta on Tuesday. Georgia election officials, poll workers and voters have reported major trouble with voting in Atlanta and elsewhere. 

Read the latest. https://trib.al/b8atVT4 http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1270428739931967490/img/CmhIKt2UWkB5uf7T.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1270428739931967490/vid/480x270/-ezPxqaQEgugYCaC.mp4?tag=13

Taxpayers have shelled out tens of millions of dollars on Project Air Bridge to get PPE to medical workers. @SenSchumer, @SenBlumenthal & I want @COVID_Oversight to use its CARES Act authority to conduct a detailed investigation of this program.

Project Air Bridge has utterly failed in its mission to get N95 masks & other PPE to areas most in need, & at a reasonable cost to health care providers. The suppliers even told us that the government has done zero oversight on the price of PPE distributed through the program.

We’ve published the responses from 6 major medical wholesalers or distribution companies involved in Project Air Bridge. They provide new details but also raise more questions about the administration’s failed efforts to distribute COVID-19 PPE. https://www.warren.senate.gov/oversight/letters/warren-schumer-blumenthal-release-new-findings-and-documents-from-investigation-of-trump-kushner-project-air-bridge-coronavirus-response

In April, @SenBlumenthal & I asked COVID-19 medical suppliers for information about Jared Kushner’s “Project Air Bridge.” We found delays, incompetence, confusion, ethics questions, & secrecy across multiple Federal agencies & the White House. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/senators-seek-investigation-into-project-airbridge-deliveries-of-protective-medical-gear/2020/06/09/935b2454-a516-11ea-bb20-ebf0921f3bbd_story.html
Important conversation with Louisville leaders on criminal justice reform. https://apnews.com/72d611401f3306ac4c058a68ebba83fb

It will make campus a much more dangerous place, leaving victims of sexual assault, gun violence, theft, drunk driving and more without any protections." https://www.yaf.org/news/leftist-organizations-begin-push-to-abolish-police-on-college-campuses-nationwide/

... las personas se esfuerzan por reinventar toda esta conversación para que sea aceptable para los votantes anglosajones y indecisos que residen en las áreas suburbanas, demuestra cuánto poder electoral y estructural tienen estas comunidades en relación con los demás.

Para progresar se necesita un equipo de personas en diferentes papeles. Como en el béisbol, no puedes criticar a un pitcher por no ser un catcher. 

Podemos responder en maneras que no afectan trabajo importante.

Y, por cierto, el hecho de que...

es obtener apoyo y transformar la opinión pública, lo cual ya lo están haciendo.

Nuestro trabajo como legisladores es escuchar lo que el pueblo pide y buscar la manera de avanzar y progresar lo más que se pueda.

Muchos critican a los activistas por la viabilidad política y dicen que necesitan un nuevo eslogan.

Pero los eslóganes probados por las encuestas y la viabilidad electoral no es el trabajo de los activistas. Su trabajo...

La gente lo ha pedido de otras maneras, pero siempre se les dice "No, ¿cómo lo vamos a pagar?"

Entonces encontraron una linea en la factura para eliminar.

"Defund"  o recortar el presupuesto de la policía significa que las comunidades de color están pidiendo las mismas prioridades presupuestarias que las comunidades anglosajonas ya tienen: escuelas > policía, etc.
